column1: Rožnov pod Radhoštěm (Czech pronunciation: [ˈroʒnof ˈpod radɦoʃcɛm]; German: Rosenau unter dem Radhoscht) is a town in the Zlín Region of the Czech Republic. It has about 16
column2: 000 inhabitants. It lies in a range of positions of approximately 360–950 meters above sea level.

column1: The town is well known for the Wallachian Open Air Museum.
